moves.4... Nf6: This is (unless I am mistaken) the two knights defense where white can and does move his knight to g5 to threaten a fork. After which, black usually castles to avoid the fork and defend the f pawn.
moves.5... O-O 6. Nxf7: ?! I feel this is an inaccuracy. Two minor pieces are usually better than a rook and a pawn, as is shown in this game as my minor pieces mill around his king.
moves.6... Rxf7 7. Bxf7+ Kxf7 8. O-O d5: So I played this move to gain more central control and prepare to develop my LSB.
moves.9. exd5 Qxd5: I felt this was better than the knight recapture as this develops my queen.
moves.10. c3: Prepping b4 to chase my bishop.
moves.10... Bg4 11. Qd2 Nh5: Here I started seeing possibilities of if I could move my knight closer, some king of sacrifice to draw his king out.
moves.12. b4 Bb6 13. a4: He's trying to trap my bishop.
moves.13... a6 14. c4: Chase, chase, chase, chase, he chases all my pieces around.
moves.14... Qd4: Kachunk. My queen settles into a solid position. (Whenever I put a piece in a good position like that, I always think of a sound like 'kachunk'
moves.15. Bb2: Eh... not a great square for long!
moves.15... Qf4: His king is under serious pressure, and I didn't want to trade queens, but I didn't see any other move that I liked.
moves.16. Qxf4+ exf4: Taking with the knight would have brought it off the rim, but this un-isolates my pawn.
moves.17. a5 Bd4 18. Bxd4 Nxd4: Black is clearly better. He has much superior piece activity (his rook is abysmal though, but no worse than white's.)
moves.19... Ne2+: ! This is a pretty nice move I think, even though it's a little obvious.
moves.20. Kh1 f3: If he oh so foolishly takes my pawn, then Bxf3# cleans up the game.
moves.21... fxg2+: I took a *long* time on this move.
moves.22. Kxg2 Nef4+: Better might have been moving the knight on h5, as that would take it off the rim.
moves.23. Kh2 Bxh3: I took a long time there too, trying to figure out which piece I should take with. I settles with the bishop because the king is on a black square and this attacks the rook. It also confines the king to only two remaining squares.
moves.24. Nc2: Trying to get some defenders over, but overlooks the threat to his rook.
moves.28. Nxf1: ? better would have been the rook. This looses the pawn.
moves.28... Rxg4 29. Ne3: This is quite good, prevents me from moving my rook to g2, and attacks it.
moves.32... Rh3 33. Nd5 Ke6: ?? I was trying to get my king involved, but I think this was a pretty bad blunder, as it allows him to win my knight.
moves.34. Nxf4+ Nxf4 35. Rxf4: Well, I'm only ahead by a pawn, but maybe I can still manage a win.
moves.35... Ke5: After all, my king is much more active.
I offered a draw. He accepted. I think except for my blunder that I played pretty well.
